title: Leaving Duty
description: Procedures for ending your shift including reports submission and checking next duty

flashcards.question: At the end of your duty, what reports are you required to complete and why?
flashcards.answer: If you have been involved in any incident that requires you to submit any kind of report form, it must be handed in by the end of your turn of duty so that details can be acted upon as soon as possible.

flashcards.question: What are the different ways of submitting reports?
flashcards.answer: Handed to your SPM, emailed or faxed.

flashcards.question: How do you find out what your next turn of duty is?
flashcards.answer: Before you leave duty you must ascertain your next turn of duty by either looking at the daily sheet for your next turn of duty or by contacting the SPM.

flashcards.question: Why is it important to hand in report forms by the end of your turn of duty?
flashcards.answer: So that details can be acted upon as soon as possible.

flashcards.question: What should you check on the daily sheet before leaving duty?
flashcards.answer: Check your next turn of duty, and any changes to your roster.

flashcards.question: What types of reports might you need to submit at the end of duty?
flashcards.answer: Incident reports, defect reports, irregularity reports, or any other required operational reports.

flashcards.question: What should you do if you're unsure about your next turn of duty?
flashcards.answer: Contact the SPM to confirm your next turn of duty before leaving.

flashcards.question: Why is it important to check your next turn of duty before leaving?
flashcards.answer: To ensure you know when you are next required to report for duty and can plan accordingly.

flashcards.question: Why should you check the daily sheet for your next duty rather than relying on memory?
flashcards.answer: Duties may change or be altered, so checking the current daily sheet ensures you have the most up-to-date information.

flashcards.question: What is the role of the SPM regarding your next duty?
flashcards.answer: The SPM can provide information about your next turn of duty if you cannot access the daily sheet.

flashcards.question: What happens if you fail to check your next duty and miss a shift?
flashcards.answer: This could lead to disciplinary action and operational disruption as no driver would be available for that service.

flashcards.question: What is your responsibility regarding checking roster changes?
flashcards.answer: It is your responsibility to check for any changes to the roster that might affect your next duty before leaving your current shift.

quiz.question: What must you do with any incident reports at the end of your duty?
options: Keep them until your next shift
Hand them in by the end of your turn of duty
Submit them within 48 hours
File them with your personal records

options: Only by post
Only in person to your manager
Handed to your SPM, emailed or faxed
Through the company app only

quiz.question: How do you find out your next turn of duty?
options: Wait for a text message from management

Look at the daily sheet or contact the SPM
Check the company website

quiz.question: Why should reports be handed in by the end of your duty?
options: To avoid a penalty
So that details can be acted upon as soon as possible
Because it's a contractual requirement
To ensure you get paid for the shift

quiz.question: What should you do if you cannot find your next duty on the daily sheet?
options: Assume you have a day off
Ask a colleague to tell you
Contact the SPM
Come in at your usual time

quiz.question: Who should you hand your report forms to at the end of duty?
options: Human Resources
Your direct supervisor only
SPM (Station Platform Manager)
The driver taking over from you

Your next turn of duty and any changes to your roster

To ensure you know when you are next required to report for duty

quiz.question: What should you do if your roster has been changed but you weren't informed?
options: Refuse to accept the change
